WRITING.TEXT: Well... I guess everyone has their preferences...

WRITING.TITLE: What's your favourite TV show right now?

WRITING.TEXT:
Yeah, that's probably why.
Thanks for taking the time to talk to me about this!

It's not that I want to be alone all the times, sometimes I really want to go out with my friends, to say, the cinema. But, when it comes to sharing things about ourselves and deepening our connection (talking about life, girlfriends, etc), I just want to distance myself for some reason.

I think just knowing they want to connect to me, I think I might be because I really don't like expressing any form of intimacy and just makes me really uncomfortable (self disclosure, hugging, and so on). That's probably why I felt more comfortable connecting to my friends when they were relative strangers, to avoid all the intimacy.

This might sound really stupid, but just don't think about it. Let the conversation flow naturally, and everything will just come to you. You could start off by asking a few questions on things that interest YOU (really important), but then let the conversation naturally go on, don't force it to!
You described me pretty much perfectly. I really want to do my own thing, too long with any close friends starts making me really uncomfortable :/

WRITING.TITLE: Ex-Prisoners of Reddit, is it true that if you "punch the big guy first", you become more dominant in prison? If not, what does?

WRITING.TEXT: Holy shit, these stories are amazing! Good work!

WRITING.TITLE: [WP] You're a person who just died and was mistakenly sent to Hell. Confused why you're there, you ask for a meeting with the Devil.
Is this an introvert thing, or something else?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi guys, not sure what subreddit I should've asked this in but here it goes:
Ever since I was about 12 (I'm 18 now), I feel uncomfortable having close friends, it just feels really weird to me.
Recently, I've had a 2 week holiday from college, and have been in solitude for the full 2 weeks just studying and doing my own things. An hour ago, I opened up my phone and have messages from a couple of close friends, but I don't know why... but I just don't want to talk to them.
It's not that they're bad friends, I think they're absolutely awesome, I just feel uncomfortable for some reason having close relationships with anybody, even to an extent with my own family members.
I think it happens more when I'm alone with someone close to me, I feel uncomfortable.
Is this introversion or something else entirely?
Thanks in advance for any advice.
